searchDocs.title: Getting Started with Motus
searchDocs.content: Getting Started with Motus Here are some quick links to get started with Motus: APIInstallation guideExamples

searchDocs.title: Method 1 - Package Manager (Wally)​
searchDocs.content: Using Wally, just add motus = "notkaif/motus@1.0.3" to your wally.toml Then run   wally install   in the command line!  Need the Luau types?Using wally-package-types run  wally-package-types --sourcemap sourcemap.json Packages/

searchDocs.title: Method 2 - Manual​
searchDocs.content: Visit the latest releaseUnder Assets, click Motus.lua Using Rojo? Put the file into your game directly.Using Roblox Studio? Open the file, copy its contents, and paste into a ModuleScript and call it Motus.

searchDocs.title: AnimationInput​
searchDocs.content: </> type AnimationInput = Animation | string | number Represents an input that can be used to identify an animation. Can be an Animation instance, an asset ID string ("rbxassetid://1234") or a numeric asset ID.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Motus.new( model: Model -- The model containing an Animator instance. ) → MotusAnimator-- A new MotusAnimator bound to the model's Animator. Creates a new MotusAnimator object and initializes the animation cache.

searchDocs.title: Preload​
searchDocs.content: </> MotusAnimator:Preload( Input: AnimationInput & {AnimationInput}-- The animation(s) to load and cache. ) → () Preloads and caches one or multiple animations for future playback.

searchDocs.title: Play​
searchDocs.content: </> MotusAnimator:Play( animation: AnimationInput,-- The animation to play. priority: Enum.AnimationPriority?,-- Optional playback priority. speed: number?,-- Optional playback speed multiplier. weight: number?,-- Optional blending weight. fadeTime: number?-- Optional fade-in duration. ) → AnimationTrack -- The loaded or cached AnimationTrack. Plays an animation on the attached Animator. Automatically loads and caches it if necessary.

searchDocs.title: Stop​
searchDocs.content: </> MotusAnimator:Stop( animation: AnimationInput,-- The animation to stop. fadeTime: number?-- Optional fade-out duration. ) → () Stops a single animation if it's currently playing.

searchDocs.title: StopAll​
searchDocs.content: </> MotusAnimator:StopAll( fadeTime: number?-- Optional fade-out duration. ) → () Stops all currently cached and playing animations.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> MotusAnimator:Destroy() → () Cleans up all cached animations and destroys them. Stops all currently playing tracks and clears internal memory.

searchDocs.title: Simple Idle Animation​
searchDocs.content: We can make a Model (in this case a Humanoid character) have an idling animation Create a script under the Model  Ensure the animation you create is loopedEnsure your Motus module is somewhere the script can access  Copy and paste this into the Script:  local Motus = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.Motus) -- For this example, Motus is under ReplicatedStorage local Character = script.Parent local Animator = Motus.new(Character) local Animation = Character.IdleAnimation -- The animation is located inside the character -- Either 3 of the below is valid for Motus Animator:Play(Animation) -- Plays the animation object Animator:Play("rbxassetid://1234567890") -- Plays the animation which has an ID of 1234567890 Animator:Play(1234567890) -- Plays the animation which has an ID of 1234567890

searchDocs.title: Animate whilst key is down​
searchDocs.content: We can make our own Player do an animation whilst a key is down. For example, I create an animation that has the player's arms rotate, and it's looped, and it will play whenever the [E] key is held down  Create a LocalScript inside StarterPlayerScripts and copy and paste this into the Script:  local Motus = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.Motus) -- For this example, Motus is under ReplicatedStorage local Player = game.Players.LocalPlayer local Character = Player.Character or Player.CharacterAdded:Wait() local UserInputService = game:GetService("UserInputService") local Animator = Motus.new(Character) local Animation = "rbxassetid://1234567890" -- Our animation for example UserInputService.InputBegan:Connect(function(input) if input.KeyCode == Enum.KeyCode.E then Animator:Play(Animation) end end) UserInputService.InputEnded:Connect(function(input) if input.KeyCode == Enum.KeyCode.E then Animator:Stop(Animation) end end)

searchDocs.title: Bonus: Cleanup when Player dies​
searchDocs.content: We can cleanup our Motus Animator once the player dies, if we were to make an animation script that runs inside of the Character  local Motus = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.Motus) -- For this example, Motus is under ReplicatedStorage local Character = script.Parent local Animator = Motus.new(Character) Character.Humanoid.Died:Once(function() Motus:Destroy() -- Cleans up and removes all cached animations to prevent memory leaks end)
